line_1: The husbandman toils with his spirits depress'd;
line_2: To-morrow will be a sweet Sabbath of rest!

line_1: By what elated, soothed, seduced, depress'd,
line_2: Full well I know — these Records give the rest.

line_1: Obscur'd her Worth, her Genius half depress'd!
line_2: How oft thy lov'd Sapphira melts thy Breast,

line_1: Their notes are cheerful, nor with sighs depress'd;
line_2: In concert join and soothe your cares to rest.

line_1: SLOW RISES WORTH, BY POVERTY DEPRESS'D:
line_2: This mournful truth is ev'ry where confess'd,
"For in thy pure and spotless breast,
Drive gloomy Sorrow from your Breast,

line_1: 'Tis pity a genius should be so deprest!
line_2: Why so? says Miss Rhymer, displeas'd; I protest

line_1: To Ravish Her? That Thought was soon depress'd,
line_2: Which must debase the Monarch to the Beast.

line_1: The king, so late by woe deprest,
Not yet by Vice or tainted or deprest,
line_2: But few the cares that fill her artless breast,
His drowsy lids, and thus alarm'd his rest.

line_1: ' No pains have conquer'd, and no fears deprest?
line_2: 'Is there a Roman, whose unskaken breast

line_1: The soul heav'n form'd to soar, by woe deprest,
line_2: Nor heeds the pangs that pierce a gen'rous breast.
